timeline.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: As discussed in the open-source meeting, let us use Alcor Thread pool if possible. Please refer to PR #424 for details.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: It's only test code. And the original thread pool provides more flexibility.
replies.author: Gzure

replies.bodyText:
Well. Which kinds of features are available in original thread pool but not in Alcor thread pool?
Meanwhile, we plan to make this more than test code :-)
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Could we have a brief comment here to explain each method, as well as the map (e.g., what the key is)?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: The map key is the Host IP, the value is Host ACA handled result statuses.
replies.author: Gzure

timeline.message:
add grpc async send goalstate
export grpc thread pool

timeline.bodyText: In v2 NetworkConfiguration, could we get rid of rsType and OpType, which are supposed to be DPM internal and not part of the contract.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: If we remove rsType and OpType, DPM should add more rest APIS to identity which resource and operation should update.
replies.author: Gzure

replies.bodyText: rsType and OpType are resource-level fields, not on the message level. That being said, there will be OpType inside each top-level resource. For example, router_internal always has field already, and we will add to more top-level resources.
replies.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Well, I think we can keep these two fields, and add OpType in top-level resources in the future.
replies.author: Gzure

timeline.bodyText:
Looks like supporting thread pool is something missing in our Alcor async executor. Could you evaluate with @chenpiaoping to see what need to add into our own executor.
Ideally we would like to replace it with our own implementation. I understand it may take some time but we will need to know what the gap is so that we could plan for it.
timeline.author: xieus

timeline.message:
add grpc async send goalstate
export grpc thread pool
